text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Today I got so many requests and have been
getting so many requests for something

Space Invaders! It’s so classic, I can’t
believe I haven’t done it yet.

And, Valentines Day is coming up so I thought,
why not combined the 2!

So today I am going to be making Space Invader
Box of Chocolates.
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: Rice Krispies
Cereal, whole almonds, Snickers,

You can pick any candy you like, but I love
Snickers! And you don’t need a lot

of them, these are just bite sized. They're just little
fun sized, like me, little!
And, chocolate melts.

I got this Space Invader Tray online, I’ll
put a link down below so if you’re interested
in getting 1 the link will be down there.

A cutting board, a sharp cutting knife and…
A squeezy bottle.

The 1st thing I’m doing is putting my 3
fillings onto the cutting board, and I’m

just gonna take my knife and chop up my almonds
and Snickers.

And you can use any kind of filling that you’d
like, if you like Reese’s Pieces or Oreo's

or caramel, or if you have a favorite cereal,
anything you want.
These are just some of my favorites.

Now that we’ve got our fillings chopped
up, you’re gonna take your chocolate melts

and you’re gonna heat them up and I’m
gonna be putting them in a squeezy bottle

so its easier for me to manage, but you can
also use a ziplock bag or a small spoon,

but I’m gonna be using the squeezy bottle,
so go heat your chocolates!

Now, take your melted chocolate and you’re gonna
fill each mold about 1/3 full, just fill

it up a little less than 1/2 way. Just squeeze
the chocolate in there.

You can also use a little toothpick, to push
the chocolate into the corners,

because this is a smaller design. Just go
doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
And push ‘em in the corners.

After you’re done filling all the little
molds with chocolate you’re just gonna

pop this little tray into the freezer and let it freeze
for about 5 minutes for it to harden.

And then when we take it out, we’re gonna
be adding our little fillings on top, and

then covering the rest in chocolate. Yum,
yum, yum, yum!

Now that you’ve got all of your fillings
in the mold, you’re gonna take your

chocolate, fill it up to the top, cover the
fillings, and then we’re gonna

pop this in the freezer for 10 minutes, and
we’re gonna decorate our box
of chocolates while it’s freezing!

While those are in the freezer, we are gonna
decorate our heart candy boxes.
I have a bunch of different sizes over here.

So there’s a small 1, a medium 1, and a
large 1, whatever you want to use…

Go for it! These are really inexpensive at
the store, they’re only like $1.99,

and if you have any leftover, if you got 1
as a gift last year and you

wanted to repurpose it, this is a really good
time to do it.

You’re also gonna need liquid chalk markers,
a piece of red scrapbook paper,

scissors, a pencil and this is a chalkboard
decal, so on the front…

Looks like a chalkboard, and on the back it’s
like a sticker.

I ordered this off of an Etsy site, but they’re
all over the internet, I’ll put a link
down below if you’re interested.

If you want to use just a piece of black paper,
like black scrapbook paper, you can
do that too! This is just an option.

I’m gonna use the medium sized heart, so
what you’re gonna do is place it, trace it,
with your pencil, and cut it out.

Now that you’ve got your hearts cut out,
we’re gonna glue them down on the top
of your box.

OK, so I’m just gonna take a little bit
of Tacky glue or Elmer’s glue,

you can use whatever glue you want, doesn’t
matter, just put a thin coat

right on the top. I’m just gonna take a
little spongy brush, moving it around.

Now you’re gonna take your red heart, and
you’re gonna put it on top, line it up.

Now you’re gonna take your black heart which
is your smaller heart,

and you’re gonna stick it in the middle,
and if you don’t have a decal, because this

is a sticker, you can just take a black piece
of paper, like I said, and use a little
Tacky Glue and put that in the middle.
You just peel it off. So cool!
Then you’re just gonna place it in the middle!

Now I’m just gonna take these liquid chalk
markers and I’m just gonna decorate

the front of my heart candy box, and I’m
gonna write, “You Invaded my Art”…

Ooops! And I’m gonna write, “You Invaded my
Heart”! Dawwwwww!

After you’re done decorating your heart
candy box, you’re gonna take your chocolates

out of the freezer, and we’re gonna pop
them out of the mold.

Now you’re gonna take your candy cups, I
found these at Michaels, and we’re gonna

fill all of our little chocolates and put
them in our box!
Oh he’s so cute! Look at him!
Then I’m just gonna fill my whole box.
Ta-da!

Here are our Space Invader Box of Chocolates!
They’re so cute! Look at this!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it! Let me
open ‘em up so you can see all of our
little chocolates in there.

Aw, there they are, pew, pew, pew, pew, pew,
pew, pew, pew!

And then we got our cute lid that we decorated,
awwww!
You invaded my heart!
Dawwww!

I hope you guys enjoyed it and I hope you
have a good Valentines Day.

If you guys have any other Ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen.

Also, you can follow me on Twitter, Instagram,
Facebook, Tumblr, I will post tons of
pictures of these little invaders!

And if you guys make them, please send me
pictures, I love seeing your creations,
I get a big kick out of it.
Alright, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
